title: DIY Weird School Supplies You Need To Try 2017! Prank Your Friends And Teachers!

json.text: You're my love!
You're my love!
*Music playing*.

00:00:29,740 --> 00:00:33,000
Hey guys, it's Wengie,welcome back and unicorn hug!
So you guys wanted more back to school videos, here is another one!
I wanted to do some weird school supplies, for you guys!
So some of these actually turned out pretty cool,I can't wait to show, you guys!
And also, don't forget if you subscribe to this channel, right now, you'll be a part of the Mac Book Air giveaway,that's running currently!
And also,you'll be joining this wonderful family, like I love you guys so much!
And the only other you need to do to be part of this giveaway, is to subscribe to my second channel, chichis ReactiCorns, I can't wait to see you there!
And,oh my gosh, guys, if we get this video to like 139,000 thumbs up, that will be amazing!
I'm going to give you 3 seconds for you guys to do this,1, 2, 3!
Have you guys done it?
Awesome! So without further ado, let's get on with the video! Let's go!
*Music playing*
Wendy: Noooooooooooo!
Wengie: You know,Wendy,that would never happen with those twisty crayon pens?
Wendy: Yeah,but they're still expensive!
Wengie: Why don't you make them yourself, like me?
Wendy : Huh?
Wengie: You can make your own DIY twisting crayon pens, with some used chapstick containers!
Wengie: Just break up a crayon into a bowl, and then add a small amount of vaseline as well; the vaseline actually softens it a bit, so it will work in these containers, but don't add too much!
Wengie: Melt this over a double boiler, and mix well until it's smooth, then pour it into your chapstick container - just be careful with this part, it's pretty hot!
Wengie: Then,you just need to let it stand until it's set, you'll be able to twist your crayon out of your chapstick container, just like a store-bought crayon pen!
Wengie: Pretty cool, right?
Ain't kidding now!
Whoa...or...oh...!
Ain't kidding now!
*Music playing*
Miss Wedgie: Okay, class, so just letting you know 99% of the exam question, we taught in this class, so listen carefully!
Wengie: Whoa!
Miss Wedgie: Wengie! What are you doing? Are you concentrating?
Wengie: Wow,look at this pen, it's so magical!
Wendy: Whoa!
Miss Wedgie: Wengie! Wengie!
*Music playing*
Miss Wedgie: Whoa!
*Music playing*
Wengie: This lava pen was totally magical, and inspired by the amazing Corina Garcia, I wanted to make mine a little more pen-shaped, so I used some long craft test tubes!
Wengie: You'll also need some water, food colouring, baby oil, a ball-point pen, some air-dry clay,and some acrylic paint!
Wengie: First, fill out your test tube about half-way with some water, and your favourite food colouring, and mix it well - I used this super cool aqua colour!
Wengie: Next, fill the rest of your test tube up with  baby oil!
*Music playing*
Wengie: Set this aside for now, and we can start working on the pen!
Wengie: First,apply a small amount of hot glue to the open end of your pen tube to prevent any liquids from getting inside!

Wengie: This next part is a little bit tricky, but you basically need to tunnel a hole through the middle of the cork lid, which I actually did, using with a chopstick, but you can find something similarly shaped around the house!
Wengie: Then, pop your pen tube through the cork, and seal the openings in some hot glue, and you should have something like this!
Wengie: Next, push the cork lid tightly on to your test tube, and then set it with hot more glue!
Wengie: Now, use some air-dry clay to mold around the pen tip to make it look a bit more pen-shaped, and when it's dry, paint over it with some acrylic paint!

Wengie: You may need two or three coats with this;I made three different colours, and I honestly love these weird lava lamp pens - they're so magical and mesmerising to look at,  just try not to get too distracted in class!
*Music playing*
Miss Wedgie: Okay, class, listen up, it's time to glue your pictures on your vision board!
Miss Wedgie: There'll be 'Show And Tell' afterwards!
Miss Wedgie: Wengie, what did I say about bringing makeup to class?
Wengie: But, Miss!
Wengie: That's enough, young lady, I'm confiscating this! You'll get it back after class!
*Music playing*
Wengie: I love surprising people with weird school supplies, by switching containers,and this lipstick glue stick is no different!
Wengie: It's also so simple to do, you only need an old lisptick container,and a glue stick!
Wengie: Clean out your lipstick well beforehand!
Wengie: Next, remove the entire glue stick,and basically just stick your lipstick container straight into the glue,trim away any excess glue, and you're basically done!
Wengie: I used some disappearing purple glue, so it look even more like an actual lipstick, which will definitely end up, fooling a few friends, and maybe even your teachers!
*Music playing*
Miss Wedgie: Well, I do have a date later on tonight, maybe I'll use a little bit of this!
Miss Wedgie: What,wait,what is this?
Miss Wedgie: Uggh!
*Music playing*
Wendy: What? I swear this eraser was new!
Wengie: Huh, that sucks! Luckily,that never happens to me!
Wendy: What is that?
Wengie: It's an eraser!
Wengie: You want one?
Wendy: Cool!
Wengie: Welcome!
Wendy: Kind of weird!
*Music playing*
Wengie: These giant eraser balls look a little bit like lollipops, but they're actually so useful!
Wengie: You just need some eraser clay, which I bought online, and some regular pencils!

Wengie: Just take some clay, and mold it into a ball, or any shape you'd like, and stick it onto the end of your pencil - then, bake this in the oven for about thirty to forty-five minutes, or according to instructions on your package!
Wengie: When they're out, just use a little hot glue to stick them onto the ends of your pencil, and you're done; you wouldn't run of your eraser ever again, and they look really cute!
*Music playing*
Wendy: Hey, Wengie, my lips look pretty dry; can I borrow your EOS?
Wengie: Er, this is not lip balm, I use it to study!
Wendy: Er, that makes no sense!
Wengie: Oh here, I'll show you!
*Music playing*
Wengie: I love these cute little EOS containers, and I always feel like throwing them away is such a waste - so here's a bit of a weird DIY I made with them!
Wengie: You'll need an used EOS container, a highlighter, an Exacto knife, scissors, a safety pin, and a hot glue gun!

Wengie: First, take apart your EOS container, including the plastic dome lining, and the top cover by prying it out - make sure you have parental supervision for this, by the way, because this can get dangerous!

Wengie: Next, use a knife to cut out the grate from the middle piece - next, you'll need to use your knife to cut away the outer plastic ridge of the see-through dome, so all that's left is the dome, itself!
Wengie: Seriously, guys, be careful with this part - take apart your highlighter, by prying the end off, and removing the sponge!

Wengie: Next, use a safety pin, and poke it through the nibs to remove that as well ;now, take your hot glue gun, and just use the metal part to bore a hole, through the centre of the dome, just big enough to fit your highlighter nib, and then pop it through!
Wengie: Now, take some acrylic paint in whatever  colour you'd like, but I chose pink because I'm making a pink highlighter!
Wengie: Then, paint the inside of the dome completely pink, you may need two coats to completely cover it as well!
Wengie: Now, pop the centerpiece of the EOS onto the top piece,and then, rest the dome upside down inside, this is a level where you want to hot glue the middle piece in like this!
Wengie: Next, cut off a short part of the highlighter sponge, and stick it around the nib, and finally click the bottom part on to finish off your highlighter!
Wengie: When you take off the top, it should look like something like this, which I thought was so cute, and also a little bit different!
*Music playing*
Wendy: Oh, that's so cool, but my lips are still dry!
*Music playing*

Wengie: So did you guys learn something new, today? If you did and get to any of these DIYS, don't forget to hashtag #wengiecorns, so I can see them, and like them, and comment on them, and before we go, let's see what happened on ReactiCorns, this week?
Max: I want to be... do you know?
Wengie: Browser! Max: Browser!
Max: A browser is like Google Chrome or Firefox!
Max: Browser!
Max: Tell me to do  and go Chrome, you go and do Chrome!
During the week, don't forget to find me on my social medias, I post there all the time, it's come to where I have to say, bye guys, and love you!
